meta.execution_mode: Planner-only; implementation via separate Lead Developer chat PRs

guiding_principles.scope_constraint: ONLY EU-funded or EU-facilitated opportunities that accelerate adoption/validation of AiGov; exclude investors, generic GTM, non-EU opportunities.
guiding_principles.product_positioning_hypothesis: AiGov wedge = GDPR method + EU locale/language + client-specific policy + agent-system testing + evidence + remediation; focus on audit-grade artifacts, repeatability, determinism.
engineering_method: eval-first / TDD (tests+fixtures define scope/behavior before implementation)
adapter pattern for OSS stitching; keep AiGov canonical contracts as source of truth
deterministic outputs (stable IDs/hashes; avoid non-deterministic fields)
repo_patterns_to_follow: contracts and schemas in packages/specs (docs/contracts + schemas)
module cards + interface ledger updated alongside changes
M_LiveRun is reference module for structure and docs style

notes: Evidence memo anchored on EDPS GenAI orientations v2, AI Act logging/monitoring obligations, and enforcement examples.
Addendum reframes evidence memo into EU programme language: EUSAiR pilots, AI Act sandboxes, TEFs, EDIHs.

working_conclusions: Competition buckets: AI governance suites; privacy program platforms; testing/red-teaming; EU-native AI Act/ISO tools.
AiGov differentiation likely in compliance-native system testing + evidence/remediation loop, not generic documentation or generic red-teaming.

stream_oss_modules.oss_stitching_thesis: Value comes from tailored composition: define ideal use case + canonical contracts + deterministic workflow; then stitch OSS/general-purpose tools via adapters; keep AiGov contract/evidence model as moat.

decisions.v0_1_sector: not finalized; allowlists include at least public + healthcare; legacy derivation uses sector='unspecified'
decisions.industry_locale_model: Context Stack Aâ€“D encoded as context_profile + deterministic policy_pack_stack order: baseline -> jurisdiction -> sector -> client
decisions.per_requirement_attribution: deferred (v0.1 provenance is policy_pack_stack order only)
decisions.intake_philosophy: Intake is evidence distillation + gap loop (not a classic questionnaire-first UX).

recent_prs.129: Implemented MUST scope for Intake OUTPUT context stack; context_profile validated fail-closed vs allowlists; deterministic stack enforced; legacy locale_context derives context_profile; mismatch locale_context vs context_profile.jurisdiction fails closed.
recent_prs.130: Continuation/supporting changes (tests/docs/ledger) for Intake context stack enforcement.
recent_prs.131: Continuation/supporting changes (tests/docs/ledger) for Intake context stack enforcement.

known_edge_case.issue: locale_context: null may pass (fail-open) unless explicitly rejected when key present
planned_fix: add PR-gate fixtures for: null locale_context; unknown jurisdiction; unknown sector; invalid stack order
ensure both-missing case (no context_profile and no locale_context) is fail-closed

phase_1_contracts.goal: Define canonical intake bundle artifact and schemas/validators/tests before integrating any OSS tooling
deliverables: evidence model (evidence per field or global evidence index + refs)
fail-closed validators in EP and PE tests/fixtures

open_design_choice.question: Evidence model shape
options: A: evidence[] embedded per field (simpler auditing, more verbose)
B: global evidence index + field->evidence refs (dedupes, scales better)
open_design_choice.default_recommendation: B (global evidence index + refs), unless auditing simplicity strongly preferred

steps: Extract drafts (can be stub/manual at first) -> intake_bundle_draft_i.json
Reconcile drafts deterministically -> candidate bundle + conflicts/unknowns
Gap analysis driven by policy_pack_stack -> clarification_questions
Readiness gate (SLA basis): unresolved critical unknowns/conflicts <= threshold

phase_3_llm_council.goal: Plug-in council as ONE implementation of Extract; enforce schema, provenance, and determinism via validators/evals
notes: Multi-perspective extraction + reconciler is useful only when bounded by schema + evidence + deterministic gates.
Golden docs can start as a small seed set; scale later. Focus evals on schema-level correctness + provenance + unknown/conflict handling.

phase_4_stitching.goal: After contracts/workflow are stable, evaluate OSS adapters (PAR/CNIL/etc.) and deterministic policy engine (OPA)
candidates: OPA as deterministic client policy constraints engine
PAR DPIA Form as optional intake UX source via adapter
CNIL PIA as reference architecture / optional isolated import
